review: It does the job but be prepared for a long, rough road if you're body reacts to this like mine did. I had a dental infection that wouldn't go away with keflex or penicillin, so they prescribed this for me & within 2 days the pain in my tooth was finally gone. However, around day two of the meds I began experiencing extreme dizziness/vertigo, nausea, throwing up, loss of appetite, pain in my mid abdomen that felt like the worst hunger pains one could ever feel. Borderline debilitating! I almost considered feeling the pain of the tooth in order to stop feeling the pain of this medicine. I am on day 5 now & have just begun itching badly. Can't sleep, can't get comfortable. The only thing I found that helps ease the problem a little is to eat first thing in the morning, always eat when you take the pill even if you have no appetite and wanna throw up at the thought of food (this medicine definitely did that to me) there is also a bad taste. This pill is both wonderful & horrible.
The doctor prescribed me metronidazole  for dental abscess 3 times a day for 5 days. I don't think it's effective. I still have throbbing pain. Now ,I have slightly headache too.

Was diagnosed with a root canal infection, I have a high tolerance for pain but this was something else! I would gladly lose a limb to stop the pain.I’ve been taking 30mg codeine/paracetamol with 40mg Tramadol and 600mg ibuprofen to stop the pain but my cocktail didn’t do anything. After taking three 400mg metronidazole over 12 hours my pain was gone!!

Knocked out the (dental) infection FAST.  Unfortunately the side effects were not worth the it. Almost from the first dosage I experienced nausea, dizziness, irritability, and off-the-scale exhaustion.  For entire 10 day cycle I was basically a zombie.    Bottom line, yes it worked wonders on the infection, but I will not be taking it ever again.  The side effects are just not worth it.

Had a tooth extraction a molar. Pain after extraction got gradually worse until almost unbearable. Went back to the dentist 5 days after extraction and had a dry socket. Cleaned it out packed it and gave me metronidazole 400g 3 times a day. I am now on day 2 and only just start to kick in. Paracetamol and ibroprufen did not do anything towards the pain. I do feel nausea , bad headache and developed an itchy rash on my jaw line and neck also my legs feel weak. I see how I get on next day or so but think I have to just sit it out as the pain is getting less now. All I wanted was the pain to ease which It seems to do now

I had a severe tooth infection and every painkiller and what-not didn't work and I had to resort calling the ambulance during the night as the pain was so excruciating that I couldn't sleep nor do anything and imagine a grown-ass man crying due to the pain.  It was even worst than having a bone broken and I've had my leg broken several times. Got Metronidazole for a week and the 1st day itself I slept like a log and the pain was gone. I used it for the whole week, 3 times a day, and now my tooth pain is all gone. Really recommend this.

Second time being on this antibiotic for a tooth abscess. First time round I had them it kicked in after a day or so. This time round it’s taking a little longer but I can feel it working. I’m on day 2 of tablets now and the swelling has changed and become flatter. I had pain radiating to my ear and down my throat and the throats eased a bit. Yes these give me a dodgy belly and this time round have wiped me out (I’ve been awake for about 3 hours of the day on day one of these) but if they work as well as last time it’s a small price to pay for the effectiveness of these tablets.
I'm on them now and still in terrible pain, they don't seem to be working
I had a severe toothache and gum swelling I start to take metronidazole this morning I really hope it works.

Was prescribed amoxil over the phone by the dentist receptionist for a 'silent' chronic infection that had started causing trouble. Picked them up Friday evening but late sat night the pain was unbearable and I couldn't sleep. I had swelling on my gums, lips, cheek and crucially my eye which is an emergency and can be v dangerous. I managed to get an out of hours hospital dentist appointment sun at 4pm.They prescribed metronidazole in addition to amoxi. This helped to knock out the pain quick but gums and face still swollen and feel v unwell/wiped out and depressed so 7/10 cause it worked for pain but is quite nasty stuff.Also, thanks to the weight of the out of hours dentists opinion I have managed to get my root canal appointment prioritised so if u feel your life is in danger, please call 111(UK) and get a second opinion.

Have a severe infection with lots of swelling to the cheek got prescribed metronidazole first dose I took made me a little dizzy and nauseous but within a day has helped a lot with the pain for sure.  Considering the amount of pain I have been in the last few days the slight side effects seem well worth it so far, hopefully the swelling goes down soon

I'm on my 3rd week with this drug 400mg 3 times a day I can't seem to function I'm so week extreme headaches , nausea , dizziness, I  even was in so much pain with heart burn I thought I was having a heart attack last night still in A and E at the moment.

Went to the dentist, was given an initial dose of 2000mg and then 500mg metronidazole 3 times a day. While I agree with almost anything is better than tooth pain, this medicine for me is not good. I’ve got bad dizziness, to the point of I can barley function, nausea so bad I’m throwing up, and the worst taste ever in my mouth. I'm not sure if it’s because the dosage or what, but I am not liking this med at all.
Flagyl (metronidazole):Works best in conjunction with a penicillin500mg t.i.d. Can cause gastric upset

After what can be described as agonising pain following a diagnosis of a dental abscess I was prescribed a 7 day course of 400g of Metronidazole (3 x daily). Painrelievers including Co Codamol did not even touch the pain, I was in agony. As some other reviewers comment any side effects don't even touch my gratitude for the relief it gave me after about 48 hours of taking them.  I was concerned that they weren't working but they kicked in exactly 48 hours after the first dose for me. I had some mild nausea and stomach cramps the first day but am now on day 6 and haven't experienced any side effects at all. Thank goodness for this antibiotic, I don't know how I would have survived the pain otherwise!
Flagyl (metronidazole):It just does not work on its own.Have taken repeated courses with no improvement.

I was prescribed  metronidazole 400mg 3 times daily ( flagyl) . I had a very mild toothache ( only when hot and cold it sore) but tonight is my 7th days on this med and still my pain has not gone completely. I so frustrated because it has been quite a difficult 7 days for me .I had few side effects which has been very annoying- upset stomach, sore thoughts,  blurred vision,  tired, sleepy and now Diarrhoea.I'm just hoping in the next 48 hrs thing change for me ....

200mg 3x a day for acute dental infection. I had two root canals done at the dentist, and he did say if pain continued after two days, to let him know and he would prescribe antibiotics as there may be infection within the gums.Phoned, got them, worked after the first day, finished the course as intended.Do not drink alcohol on these, take after a meal and keep hydrated and you will avoid most side effects (Also just your luck)Also as a side note. I don't recommend vaping on these, most eliquid contains Propylene Glycol, which is something the body cannot break down while taking this antibiotic.

After 1 hour of taking my first dose of 400mg my tongue and lips went tingly and then numb as if I had been given an injection of anaesthetic at the dentist. Unfortunately I had to stop it immediately as it was causing me some sort of allergic reaction, but I didn't feel sick or dizzy or any of the other side effects, and if it wasn't for the numbness in my face I think it would have worked well.

I was prescribed Metronidazole for the first time for a wisdom tooth infection. I took it as per the instructions. 3 days later I woke up with a rash. Over the next two days this gradually got worse and spread almost over my body. The rash was bright red and itchy. This was in the Covid lockdown and I was told to go into hospital where I was given strong antihistamines. I am allergic to it.

I had a dental infection. My dentist put me on a week of Amoxicillin, which helped but didn’t get rid of the infection. So she moved me onto a week of Metronidazole - and the results were almost instant.I took the first pill with breakfast at 9am. Over the next few hours my tooth became more painful. I took the second with lunch at around 2pm. The pain was by now almost unbearable. On inspection, a large abscess had come up next to my infected tooth. A few hours later the abscess burst. After thoroughly rinsing, I realised all the pain had disappeared. It’s now 2 days later and it’s still fine. The infection seems to have disappeared entirely.Metronidazole isn’t a nice drug, I did have a grumbly stomach at one point, but it certainly gets the job done.

OMG!!!! This medication is "WONDERFUL" I had a nightmare of a tooth extraction surgically and I was sliced in several areas to get my tooth out hence I have very dense bones. The pain the following week after just got worse despite taking Ibuprofen and Paracetamol every 4 hours at the same time. A revisit back to my dental surgeon who prescribed me this antibiotic. After just 2 hours the pain subsided as much as 80% I just could not believe it plus all the swelling has virtually disappeared. I just can not tell anyone how much pain I was in prior to taking this med, no sleep for a week and not able to eat, pains in my jaw right up to my ear,,,"Horrendous". So, I am only a day-in taking these meds with no side-effects whatsoever. Truly a 'miracle'.

Flagyl (metronidazole):Absolutely avoid! I'm a 29 year old male, rarely if ever take medication but unfortunately developed periodontitis due to a wisdom tooth. My dentist prescribed me Flagyl and warned me about possible stomach side effects. I took three pills 400mg and woke up the next day a different person. I felt as if I had been poisoned, my head felt like a bowling ball, I felt like I was going to fall over when I stood up. I slept all day and didn't eat a thing. I noticed later that day I could hardly breathe and that my nose was blocked. I had an awful headache and my eyes kept squinting and were sensitive to light, urine was a dark colour, my appetite was diminished to zero. It took a solid four days before I ate anything and was bed ridden 90% of that time. I am still feeling the effects from it (weakness, dizziness, weird vision issues). Peer-reviewed journal articles highlights many of other young people ages ranging from 22-25 with adverse side effects who NEVER recovered.

Took this medicine due to reoccurring tooth infection. First day felt ok and tooth pain got better. Third day was feeling fatigue and nausea. By that afternoon / evening I had diarrhoea, vomiting, fever, severe headache. I was lying down crying. Today phoned dentist and they said stop taking it. So haven’t taken any today but severe headache still . No more sickness now. Horrible medicine.

Acute tooth abscess, dead root, extreme pain with constant throbbing.. dead pulp/root removed and these metronidazole  worked a miracle at calming the infection down.. by the 4th tab pain had reduced by 80%.. no adverse reactions.. eat food with these and avoid alcohol.

I have suffered with teeth issues for years. When you’ve been in that much pain you’d take anything to never feel that pain again. I’ve had a few teeth removed and been prescribed this, I’ll take whatever comes to me. Some tablets won’t agree with you so be mindful but please try this if amoxicillin hasn’t worked. This works.

GOOD LORD!!!! I honest to God thought I was my days were ending on the 4th day of metronidazole! Nausea, diarrhea, headaches, dry mouth, restless sleep, and now my face has pins and needles in the left cheek. Loss of appetite and my butt is so sore from pooping! I will never ever take this horrible antibiotic again! I feel terrible. Thank God I have 3 tablets left! Was on this for a dental abscess and I've honestly never felt so ill in my life.

I was given Metronidazole for a tooth infection. A course of 3 a day for 3 days.Day 1: No change, tooth pain very persistent. Didn't sleep well due to pain.Day 2: Swollen face, felt very tired, could barely do anything. Felt extremely sleepy, loss of appetite and felt sick when trying to eat more than 4 spoons of rice. Felt like I was depressed (probably also due to the fact that I may have to get a tooth extraction)Day 3: The WORST!: Nausea throughout the night, especially in the morning. Couldn't even have breakfast as I felt like vomiting as soon as I tried to eat. I had to drink garlic and lemon to feel better. Felt extremely tired, low mood, sleepy, pretty much spent the whole day in bed sleeping, stomach was upset, face still Swollen. The tooth pain has improved it only hurts when I bite hard. Felt like my heart was pounding So glad I am done, but you've gotta do what you've gotta do. Hopefully all this will be worth it

Considering a dental abscess is probably the most pain I’ve ever been in, the metronidazole side effect of slightly upset stomach I had was definitely a walk in the park. Took 500 mg 2x day for 7 days, cleared up infection immediately and I felt better by dose 3. Usually I ate something soft (banana, applesauce, eggs, or seasoned rice) before I would take it and had no nausea or throwing up, my stomach occasionally did whale mating sounds but that’s not abnormal for me lol
First and foremost, this medication works like charm for anaerobic bacteria.

14 day prescription, 200mg 3x day for dental abscess/infection.  I was terrified to take this after reading the awful reviews however I experienced very minimal symptoms.   I had an upset stomach/gassy feeling here and there but most likely due to eating a lot of yogurt in between doses as suggested by the physician.   The only real symptom I had was a bad taste in my mouth.   I recommend taking after a full meal,  drink plenty of water all day, and stay away from alcohol.   I would definitely take this again if required.

Please don’t be put off by all the bad reviews here.. I am usually quite sensitive to medication but I have taken metronidazole numerous times all with no- minimal side affects (the worse being  slightly lose stools).Everyone is different so please don’t be put off taking this as it works really well, and if you have an infection well it needs treating at the end of the day. Drink lots of water and take with a meal/food.

Prescribed this 3 times a day for 5 days for an infection in my gum. Got rid of the infection right away.However I'm now a week off it and I'm still suffering from the vile bitter taste in my mouth and my tongue is covered in yellow and white gunge which no doubt is yeast. Also gave me slight headache.

Into my second day and after only 3 x 400mg tablets I stopped the treatment. I had severe stomach cramps, diarrhoea, dark urine but worst of all severe back pain. I stayed in bed for most of the day even after I stopped the treatment. I will avoid in future.
Stomach problems, tiredness, body pain, and vivid dresms.

Had a sinus infection which caused pain in the middle of my upper jaw, which then travelled down to my lower jaw. The pain affected my teeth which were otherwise in reasonable health. Took metronidazole and the pain subsided within hours. Relative had an actual tooth infection and was also prescribed same drug - same result; it worked wonders in a short space of time, less than one day.We both finished course as advised. Note: do NOT consume alcohol during and after course and wait at least 48 hours after you've finished your course. You may also feel a little out of it - this is normal, and will subside. By out of it I mean you'll see and hear things but they will take time to fully register. Take drug with plenty of water and after a meal.Hope this helps.

Flagyl (metronidazole):I had teeth abscess and my whole face swelled, it was scary.  I was prescribed augmentin with flagyl  and serodase for a week. I woke up the next day  the swelling increased.  Then within two days  pain decreased,  swelling decreased and by the fifth day everything was gone
Flagyl (metronidazole):Tooth abscess and facial swelling, took combo of Flagyl and amoxcillin. It worked but did cause nausea. Use combo as instructed

I swear to you, I took metronidazole with a few slices of toast and jam. Within 30-40 minutes I PASSED OUT. Woke up few seconds later, draped in sweat and didn’t have a clue what day it was or where I was. Rushed to my parents room to tell them to call emergency services but ended up throwing up a few times (not by choice) and I instantly felt better. This medicine (if you can even call it that) is DANGEROUS.

Flagyl (metronidazole):Flagyl has been very useful, I’ve recently changed my toothbrush and that’s how my gums got infected..I’ve tried amoxicillin first but it won’t works and the pains are not get away, therefore I combined both with this flagyl and luckily I was getting better. Of course I took some painrelievers as well, the ponstan for instance response along with pontalon to prolong its after effect, just as an extra caution. Always be safe and gentle with your body as we are the only responsible person to treat us best!

Doc prescribed me metronidazole for 7 days dose = 250mg three times a day. After the 2 first days I've started to feel confused with nearly constant headaches and head pressure I've never felt this before, the next days the brain fog is even harder, making me feel zombie-like, still constant headache and nausea, at least the abscess started to shrink but after  I finished the course it grew back. 2 weeks after I still have the brain fog, headache and tension in the back and around the temples, I'll never take this drug again it's a nightmare I wonder when the effects will stop. Talk with your doc before taking it!!

I would never take this drug again. Side effects included:* Violent vomiting even when I had nothing left in my stomach to throw up* Nausea* Diarrhea (hasn't stopped since I finished the dose 3 days ago)* Fatigue * Tingly legs and feet / shaky at time / felt unbalanced* Yeast infection on torso* Fungal acne break out on face* Loss of appetiteTips: * If you are taking it 3 times a day take it 8 hours apart (so 7am, 3pm and 11pm) with as much food as you can stomach* Do not drink alcohol at 2 days before starting (or whilst taking) * Drink as many probiotics as you can * Stay close to home / bed / toilet * Ask your doctor for something else

Flagyl (metronidazole):I've been in agony with a toothache for two days, I couldn't sleep, nothing. Last night I took 500mg of Flagyl a few hours before I went to bed, slept all night and this morning my mouth isn't even sore. I’ll continue to take it for a week to make sure it kills the bacteria, but so far I like it better than any other antibiotic I've taken for an infected tooth!

Basically my wisdom teeth are coming through and my jaw doesn’t have the space for them, my gums have been swelling bad with lots of pain, ibuprofen has slightly helped. Contacted my dentist and told him also my gums bleed bad and have an awful smell so most likely infection from something getting stuck below the swollen gums, I’m allergic to penicillin so was prescribed 400mg of metronidazole. Took the full dose for 10 days and seemed to have worked until yesterday ( 4 days after finishing ) my gums are so sore again causing headaches and lots of pain that ibuprofen and naproxen don’t even help. (Not taken together!! Ibuprofen yesterday with a 15 hour space and changed to naproxen )

I've had a dental abscess on lower left side for 1 1/2 weeks. Because of coronavirus all dentists are closed, so a phone consultation was all I could have. Prescribed a 5 day course of 500mg amoxicillin, started to clear it, but as soon as the meds were finished the infection came back on the following Sunday. On Monday (yesterday) I again spoke to dentist who prescribed another 5 day course of 500mg  amoxil. By the evening the left side of my face was really swollen. Couldn't sleep and this morning the swelling is huge and solid feeling,  like I have a tennis ball between my gum and cheek. Phoned dentist again, spoke to a different dentist who has now prescribed metronidazole alongside the amoxil. I've read the reviews and most of them are describing how I feel now because of the infection, not because of the meds. I know everyone is different, but if you have a severe infection the only thing you can do until dentists reopen is take the meds and pray the pain and swelling goes.

After suffering years with bad teeth, I finally broke down and went to dentist.  I’ve had some pain on and off, but nothing that levelled me.  XRays showed a bad abscess in my eye tooth and newly formed pocket of pus at the top of the gum line.  I didn’t even know it was there and my only pain was hot and cold sensitivity and my face looked puffy.  I just thought I was getting old. Dr. wouldn’t touch me he just kept mumbling about bad infections and IV therapy and I was at a loss because, well, I just didn’t feel that much pain.  I’m on day one of this med and I feel awful, but if it gets rid of the infection I didn’t know I had it’s worth it.  2000 MGs daily for 10 days.... I hope it  helps me!!!
Flagyl (metronidazole):No side effects but it doesn't work at all! It's a third day with pain and no improvement. Never again

Ok so am Allergic to penicillin so I have no choice but to take this antibiotic but I would happily take it anyway over a dental infection any day! It usually takes about 2/3 days to kick in for me some people sooner and some longer but it does work! As for the side effects please don’t let these comments put you off as medication works different for everybody! I do get a bit of an upset stomach, and a weird taste in the mouth but it’s nothing that’s unbearable or unmanageable, am still able to go about my day and if you are in true pain of a tooth infection then I think you would take a bit of a dodgy stomach over that unbearable pain!

I took this medicine metronidazole a year ago, prescribed by my dentist for dental infection. First pill was ok tho I felt an immediate rush and a heart beat. Realised also couldn’t stand up. Second pill was worse and literally fell on the floor because of  nausea, dizziness, heartbeat faster, and severe rush. Told my doctor and stopped it. Gonna have a dental surgery but never having this medicine again.

I've been taking Metronidazole (400mg) for two days now once every 8 hours. I can assure you it does and will help a lot if you are suffering from a dental abscess. After my 4th dose I feel no pain what so ever and the abscess is starting to feel really soft when before it seems like it was about to burst at any moment.  I'm also taking Amoxicillin (500mg) and I've had no side effects with these antibiotics but I do recommend taking the Metronidazole tablets after eating.

Tooth abscess. Two amoxicillin prescriptions didn't do the full trick. Given this  metronidazole prescription by dentist. Pharmacist warned me not to drink alcohol which it states on label. Am taking ibuprofen for pain and swelling too. Ibuprofen contains propylene glycol, which is a HUGE no no with metronidazole.MAJOR stomach upset 15 minutes after taking pill, but before ibuprofen.MAJOR diarrhea. No appetite at all.Only took thee 250mg pills and called pharmacist. Told me to STOP NOW!!!Five days later and STILL battling stomach, hunger, grogginess, depression and other issues.DO NOT DO NOT DO NOT TAKE THIS STUFF!!! Read the other reviews and mine will make more sense.

I have been taking 400mg metronidazole three times a day alongside 250mg amoxicillin three times a day for a tooth infection. Day four and pain is reduced but not gone but I feel so incredibly poorly. I look grey, feel sick all day long, awful headache, chesty cough (not sure if that’s just coincided with a cold), have no energy and can’t eat. Dry mouth with horrific metallic taste too.

I’ve been taking the metronidazole for 2 days and so far no dramatic side effects, but definitely have a metallic taste in my mouth and experienced blurred vision temporarily. But that could have been from a migraine as I do suffer with ‘silent’ migraines, as they are known. Dental infection seems improved, no stomach issues but I have lost my appetite a bit, which is perhaps why that’s the case.

I have never experienced dental pain like this before. I started 200mg metronidazole last Thursday and then was switched to 400mg yesterday morning after my 4th visit to the dentist. Cocodymol and ibuprofen are not working for pain. I literally have to wait for the antibiotics to work. After taking a total of 4 tablets of the 400mg I believe I'm feeling some type of relief. I've been told by many clinicians to hang in there which I plan on doing. The pain is unreal. I agree with the man who said, "anyone complaining about the med does not have a dental abscess!" I would give birth 10 times over to never be in this type of pain again.
The problem with this drug is it is possible for it to be carcinogenic.

I had a terrible case of peridonitis on my lower right wisdom tooth and I don’t know what’s worse; the pain from the tooth or the non stop side effects of vomiting, diarrhea, electrical shock feelings in my limbs, the taste of batteries in my mouth from this medication.

I usually take amoxicillin but as they did not seem to clear this particular tooth / gum infection my dentist prescribed these metronidazole. I am in good health no health issues just mild GERD from time to time and I’m female in my late 40s . This tablet makes me feel nauseous, headache and fuzzy head , lower stomach mild pains from time to time , a little dizzy and dry eyes irritated and tiered . I have only been taking 4 days and I’m stopping them now , I have never felt like this with other tablets or antibiotics, they seem to have cleared the infection slightly but the thought of taking another tablet worries me . I have not drunk any alcohol or coffee so unsure why they don’t agree with me but other posts seem to say the same .
Feel sick, very tired, my pain is getting  better  - thank god

I had a tooth abscess for 3 weeks I was on other antibiotics and it kept getting worse. I started taking this drug and within 24 hours the pain finally started to subside.  Yes there is some stomach issues with this medication but nothing compared to the pain from the dental abscess.  I am so glad to find something to get rid of the pain and infection!

Anyone who is complaining of the side effects of metronidazole doesn’t have a dental root abscess! After 5 days of whet can only be described as a nightmare of pain and amoxicillin and every painkiller known to man doing zero for me. I  finally got given metronidazole which has worked! Thank the lord. Didn’t notice any effects and even if I had would take them over dental abscess pain anytime.

Wish I had read up on this medication  before taking it. Was prescribed 15  metronidazole tablets  for a dental abscess and have taken 5.  i have had horrendous side effects, totally unexpected as I have taken many courses of antibiotics over the years. Nausea ++ , bad headaches, muscle weakness all over, feeling overwhelmed and low confused mood... after 5 tablets! Feel like I’ve been poisoned or something. Beware is all I can say.

Flagyl (metronidazole):At first I felt a bit nauseous and had a whole body feeling like I had the flu when I started the meds. My dose was 500mg four times daily. I ate an Activia yogurt daily and took Ranitidine to help with nausea. I would find that slowly sipping a caffeinated soda would also help with the nausea and give more energy. I had a severe infection and it cleared it up.

After reading some of these comments I really did not want to take this medication. However after taking it my abscess and swollen face has almost cleared and I am out of pain. I took this alongside amoxicillin and it has worked absolute wonders with absolutely no side effects what so ever. Some people may react different how ever. But it was an absolute life saver for me, it’s the first time I’ve ever had an abscess and the pain was horrendous. Kind regards,María.
Took swelling of face down a bit, but dental abscess did not go away

Started this medication this morning after wisdom extraction last Sat which resulted in a severe dry socket. Day 1 of 5 (400mg 3 times a day) no adverse reaction yet.  I was told by day 3 I'll see a huge difference  so fingers crossed as dry socket is horrendous!!!!!

This drug has destroyed me. I still have side effects 3 months later . Headaches , fevers , my stomach feels bloated . Feeling detached . There is a Facebook group you can join with other sufferers . The only thing that helped me was taking benfotiamine a form of vitamin b1 taken with magnesium . It has helped me recover over 2 to 3 weeks . Your brain is basically stripped of thiamine while taking this metronidazole as it crosses the blood brain barrier . I hope this helps others who are suffering . I will take b1 forever now .

Flagyl (metronidazole):I am not one to write reviews but this has to be done. I am based in the UK and was given this medication for wisdom tooth pain. I was told to take it three times a day for 5 days. After two days I was unfortunately a victim of being the 1 in 10,000 to receive rare side effects from the medication. I had external dizziness & blurred vision every 30seconds. I went to go GP(doctor) and they said I was given a high dosage and it should of been 2 tablets per day. After 9 painful days the antibiotic was cleared from my body and I am dizzy and blur free. I wrote this reviews because of the hours of research I have seen no one state  how long it took for the side effects to disappear without hospital treatment. Hopefully this helps someone. Overall the tablet got rid of the pain but the extreme dizziness as a side effects was not worth it

It works well for a severe dental infection. The big thing is the warning 'no alcohol'.It means NO alcohol.I was fine until I inadvertently ate a prawn cocktail with alcohol in the sauce without thinking.Dreadful.As I am a cardiac patient anyway, the chest tightness and palpitations are dangerous. There really MUST be more comprehensive warnings on this drug.Particularly for heart patients.The benefits are good, but the downsides are potentially fatal.

Was prescribed 200mg of Metronidazole 3 times a day along with 500mg of Amoxicillin for a dental abscess. I've taken Amoxicillin several times before and I know I have no adverse reaction, so all of the side effects must be due to the Metronidazole.Had a severe wisdom tooth infection which completely locked the right hand side of my jaw, and was prescribed Metronidazole by the emergency dentist. Seems to be working as I'm now on day 4 and my jaw has mostly unlocked and the pain and swelling has reduced greatly, but the side effects are horrible.I'm so tired constantly and feel as if I have no motivation to do anything, which is awful at work. It's also given me anxiety and a really tight chest and heart palpitations, which aren't helping the anxiety. I have headaches and brain fog and my stomach definitely doesn't feel right. If possible, I would recommend requesting another form of antibiotics. They've been just about bearable for me, but I wouldn't take them again unless there was no other option.

I nearly didn’t take Metronidazole after reading these comments. I’m so glad I decided to take it anyway as it is curing my dry socket. I took advice from one review and am eating a lot of live yoghurt (with ginger) and probiotics. I’m also making sure I eat before taking it. I find that I feel sick if I don’t eat regularly. I’m feeling very tired but at the end of the day I feel lucky to have access to antibiotics.

Currently taking this metronidazole (3x400mg) along with amoxicillin (3x500mg) for upper back tooth abscess. It's only been a day, abscess hasn't gotten worse but yet to see any real improvement. Private dentist, they keep their own supply, receptionist blundered by saying you don't have to take with food. Oh yes you do, or you'll get the nausea, rumbling tummy and burping I did before I read the label. Yesterday my eyes were stinging too, despite staying well hydrated. I got cranky, had night sweats, hot flashes and throbbing temple, reported by others too, but I'm a woman of a certain age so some of it could be down to that too. I took Ibuprofen last night to reduce pain and inflammation so I could get a decent sleep for the first time in days, helped a lot. Don't normally take any meds but feel right now it's a necessary evil. Once both courses are complete I'll be taking probiotics to ward off gut problems.

oh my goodness what an experience. I started these on Tuesday around midday. It’s now Thursday 4pm and I feel rough. I can’t leave my bed I keep feeling very weak and shaky, extreme diarrhoea and shivering. I was prescribed a five-day course of Metronidazole by my dentist.  I felt a bit unwell the first day I took it but much worse on the second day.  I didn't sleep at all well on both these nights. I told my dentist I couldn't continue with this drug.  My dentist offered me an appointment that day but I was too unwell to get there.  After taking the drug for two days I felt no difference in the sore tooth. I'll see my dentist again tomorrow...

Was prescribed metronidazaole along with amoxicillin by the dentist for an abscess. 6 days later these antibiotics had wiped out the good bacteria in my gut leaving me very very unwell. I have used metronidazole many times now most recently for a tooth abscess and I have always been perfectly fine with no side affects what so ever.  After the first 24hrs of taking metronidazole my pain was already considerably less,  it really works so please don’t be scared to take it if you haven’t before as not everyone will experience bad side affects.  Take this medication after a meal and a full glass of water I also make sure I stay hydrated and eat well while on it.

I took this metronidazole pill 1 time for a dental abscess and I was literally having an out-of-body experience. I was shaking, cold, crying and had a really bad nightmare. I immediately stopped taking it and I suggest that they take this antibiotic off the market PLEASE. Oh and another thing I did not drink and I made sure I took it with food

I have been prescribed metronidazole as I have an infected lower wisdom tooth, I was struggling to open my mouth, had severe headaches, earache and generally feeling unwell, this was all before I was prescribed and took Metronidazole so I'm guessing it's mainly symptoms of the infection, rather than the drug itself. I started taking this almost 4 days ago for a dental cyst triggering infection / abscess. I can’t even lift my head off the pillow on a morning to get up with my teen daughter for school. Also had pain in what I feel might be the right kidney and keep drinking loads of water as recommended. Suffered with the heartburn too, plus headaches. However, my mouth feels better
In 2 days my abscesses are disappearing after taking metronidazole and amoxicillin

Given metronidazole  for a big  dental abscess in Jan.  It worked well. No nasty side effects.Week later the 'bad' tooth broke off , exposing the roots.  So, back on the Metro five days.  No problems with side effects. Root Canal treatment  and all seemed well.9th/10th March, abscess re-appeared.  Hard to find emergency dental treatment here on weekends, but our lovely NHS came to the rescue. Local A&E saw me within 20 minutes. Talking to Nurse, the abscess burst. She prescribed Metro 400mg for 7 days, plus Clarithromycin 500mg for 7 days, plus Co Codamol for pain, though not needed it so far.Dentist said the jury's out until infection settles but recommended 5 days on the Metro was more than enough but to complete course of Clarithromycin.  Still only minor issues with Metro, but the Clarithro is making me tired, with a bad taste in mouth

I was prescribed metronidazole on Monday morning for a dental abscess, 400mg 3x daily. I'm currently taken this medication for my infected wisdom tooth which happens every two years :/ I took Metronidazole in 2015, followed by amoxicillin two years later and now the wisdom tooth is infected again lower right. I was prescribed these for a tooth abscess.  After the first dose in the evening, I was extremely nauseous and drowsy. They also give me very strange and unpleasant dreams.I asked my dentist to prescribe an alternative, which they did immediately and they are effective with no side affects.

I'm sharing my experience with you as I have been quite unwell, not being told about any side effects from this, so came on line to read about it. 1st of is yogurt.. Natural.. Take this with or after your tablet to help with sickness. I take Omeprazole already due to inflammation of the stomach lining, and ask for this also to help with sickness. (not available on NHS) on day 4, have taken 9 so far. Definitely flu symptoms: aching, sweats, sickness feeling not as bad now. I'm having yogurt, sleeping but also can't sleep feeling, mad dreams, and have cried for the 1st time in at least a year regarding feeling emotional and not due to pain! Very restless but so exhausted feeling. Will review in 2 days as has definitely decreased pain but not killed it yet!

I started taking these Friday evening (it’s now Sunday morning). I have an infected wisdom tooth on the bottom right, it has only just pierced the gum. The pain was unbearable resulting in half of my face swelling up within one day. On day one, I woke up to less pain; but still the swelling hadn’t really changed much, but I felt positive it hadn’t gotten bigger. Unless anything gets drastically worse!

Not really sure what to say, back in November (3m ago) I was on Amoxicillin for an abscess under an impacted wisdom tooth and it seemed to have cleared up. I will never use this one again . Extreme fatigue, insomnia, nausea, dizzy and depressive thoughts. I feel so bad that I can't go to work. I have 2 days left  and my body doesn't want any more of this poison. I have never had this experience on antibiotics before.

Started Metronidazole yesterday for infected wisdom tooth.Three 400 mg tablets per dayI haven't had any adverse reactions so far.The pain has been reducing.Not all meds react the same with people. Thankfully this works for me.  Youdon't know unless you try

I was prescribed Metronidazole for my infected wisdom tooth, it's 3 tablets a day for a course of 5 day. I started to take it on my second day, I felt so weak and felt I just wanted to lay down, didn't affect my appetite I was taking it with food. On my 3rd day, my wisdom tooth pain has gone, but in the evening I started to feel really dizzy, can't concentrate on conversation l sometimes could not recall what I just  said,  banging headache, diarrhoea, tight chest, nausea. On 4th day, I'm feeling still weak and dizzy and headache.  I'm allergic to penicillin.

I was given 400mg x3 daily for 7 days for a severe wisdom tooth infection. Nothing was said to me other than don't drink alcohol. However, the side effects were awful. I felt really nauseous, weak and exhausted all the time. I also felt very dizzy and unable to concentrate. I have an impacted wisdom tooth that the dentist said couldn’t be removed so close to going overseas and gave me the script emphasising NO ALCOHOL AT ALL. Day 1:  no side effects and pain went from a 10/10 to a 7. Taking ibuprofen and paracetamol every 6 hours + heat packs.  I made sure I ate something with each dose.  I haven’t noticed the horrible taste of the tablets everyone is talking about. Day 2: still no side effects apart from the metallic taste in my mouth but it’s not that bad. Pain is bearable on about 6/10. Last night I couldn’t sleep and had ache in my temple area but it wasn’t unbearable. Day 3: woke up with no significant pain and still no other side effects. The wisdom tooth area is tender and I feel a little bit off but I would say that’s because of all the painkillers I’ve been taking. So, bottom line is the side effects don’t hit everybody so worth a go if you’re in a lot of pain. To be continued........
Abscess pus must come out.Abscesses should be drained.Surgical approach for incision and debridement is best.Antibiotics do not work well for abscesses alone.

Developed a pretty nasty abcess around my tooth. After one day I could sleep and eat soft foods and after two I could go back to eating foods I needed to bite again. Now, after four days on the treatment, Only some slight swelling remains but it gets less and less noticeable every day. Having a follow up to check progress soon.As for side effects, I experienced some headaches and drowsiness which was to be expected and I was warned might happen . I had a tooth abscess for months, dentist said need to do  root canal treatment (RCT). Pulp removed, filled in medication, will be seeing my dentist again in 3 weeks to finish off the RCT. Had experience a bit of stomach discomfort, skin rashes (comes and goes) and feeling tired/ sleepy, not to the extend of nausea. Most of the abscess is gone, I hope the abscess will be completely gone before my 2nd follow up on RCT. And avoid Alcohol.

WORST drug. I thought I was going to die. I can tell u now Monday my doctor is going to hear it from me

WORKED WONDERS for my dental abscess. Midway through my A-levels, a wisdom tooth in my lower left side of mouth decided to come through, causing severe pain and subsequent PERICORONITIS. Currently suffering with an abscess. Paid £95 to see an emergency dentist last Friday and was given this antibiotic 3 x daily 400mg strength and completed the course. I took these for 5 days for a dental abscess, I had a little heartburn but that goes with over the counter tablets. The metronidazole hasn’t made the slightest bit of difference to the abscess though

Worst experience of my life. Most horrific side effects on this drug. Only had 3 x 400mg and had to stop due to severe nausea, racing heart and body trembling constantly. Awaiting root canal but very bad toothache. Took this medication with Amox and after 1 day pain lessoned by 90% and this felt amazing. Positive experience - I was prescribed a 5 day course of metronidazole 400mg 3 x daily for a tooth abscess. I wanted to review after terrifying myself from reading all the negative reviews. No further side effects for me. Cleared up my tooth abscess and I felt fine on it. I didn't drink alcohol at all in the days leading up to taking it and for about a week after. My dentist warned me that drinking alcohol with it would cause a severe reaction so definitely avoid that.

Flagyl (metronidazole):I was prescribed Flagyl three a day for 10 days due to a tonsil abscess.  I’m on the 7th day and I will not be continuing.  This medication feels like torture. It’s that bad.

Suffer with G.O.R.D. so the heartburn has been awful, only day 3, 250mg twice a day with food. Have been very dizzy, light headed & felt like holding onto things to steady myself. Infection clearing within the first two days, discomfort from abscess in glands gone after day one. Side effects much more tolerable than dental pain so far.

Flagyl (metronidazole):For a few years I have had this horrid smell coming from under my crown. I have had dental care from my dentist but the smell would persist. I am about to finish flagyl and I don't notice the smell at all. This is great, taste like crap but it works.

This is my 5th time this year on Metronidazole for an impacted wisdom tooth that can't be removed but keeps developing an abscess. I have had a severe tooth abscess which I fought on and off for a few years. Last time I had it, it gave me  the most severe pain I have ever experienced in my life! Pain last Friday, but didn't go to dentist. Banging on his door Tuesday (bank-holiday!)Cleared out an infection between 2 teeth, X-ray showed no sign of trouble.  Another sleepless night and I'm back and got 200mg Metronidazole and 500 mg Amoxicillin 3 a day for a week.  48 hours in and I'm typing this at 4.10a.m. For something to do and hopefully inform others.  Just want the pain to stop.  Taking paracetamols, but not effective.  Bonus no side effects and no horrid taste. Went to the dentist June 14th, with Toothache, had some x rays taken, and saw there was an abscess on one of my upper right teeth. Back to the dentist in 3 wks time either to have root canal or have the tooth extracted.

Had toothache for a week. Went to dentist. He cleaned out tooth and prepared for root canal.  Put temporary filling in. (2 month wait on NHS) Week later I have swelling on gum above tooth.  Another emergency appointment and given amoxcillin (penicillin) a week later my face on that side is swollen so much I look like I have a boiled sweet in there. Was given metronidazole. I was prescribed 400mg to be taken 3 times a day for dental abscess and gum boil both of which didn't clear up previously despite taking 2 full courses of amoxicillin. After day two I was awaken by severe pain around my infected tooth and had to to take codeine and ibuprofen just to not to go crazy (this type of pain is an absolute terror). I noticed a strange sensation coming from the affected area and realised it was the abscess actually draining. It just shows how powerful and effective this drug is. You will read a lot of mixed reviews and stories of horrible side effects but don't get put off by it. it is safe and effective when taken as prescribed and it is better so suffer some minor inconveniences rather than indescribable agony.

I have a infection on my tooth due to poor root treatment, I'm taking amoxicillin & Metronidazole at the same time, honestly both are not completely helping but I assume it takes some days to the remedy kicks in. I have no side effects asmost of people described.

Flagyl (metronidazole):Caught a bacterial infection from daughter visiting from Japan August 2016. Could not get well. Unknowingly had a dental abcess that made me even more ill. Did some research and found flagyl with Augmentin had helped others. Got dental problems addressed and took 21 days of flagyl 500 mg x 2 daily with Augmentin 875 mg x 2 daily. Got well. I was infection free at time of last dental work but taking this as a preventive course.

was prescribed this drug as I had my wisdom tooth out and had a abscess  and infection.  I stopped after three days stomach cramps, very painful ones, killer of headaches and diarrhea, foul taste in my mouth and constant nausea.

I have an inflammation around my wisdom tooth which has spread to tonsillitis and I was prescribed Phenoxymethylpenicillin by my GP and Metronidazole 400 / three times a day by my dentist, who agreed I can take them together. I'm on my second day now but I feel improvements, although they are very slow. Hopefully everything will be ok.

I have had an abcess in the same tooth 3 times now over the past 7/8 years the problem is its a front one so my dentist is reluctant to remove it. Prescribed flagyl after finding out I had an infection under tooth which was excruciating I couldn't eat all week so I told the dentist this but he prescribed this disgusting pill along with anti-inflammatories and paracetamol. Sat up in bed at 5 in the morning.  I've taken 3 of my recommended dose. When I  swallow them it feels like they are the size of a pineapple can somebody please tell me when the antibiotics will start working. I've had two 10lb babies but nothing compares to this gum pain

Had to stop taking this medication after 2 days because of serious side effects. First off the taste of metronidazole is horrid. Had infection in tooth root canal which had been treated several years previously. My face was swollen and the pain was waking me every night. Second time taking. 400mg  3 x a day.....always clears up abscess & I've never ever had a single side effect.
